description: Town & Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended); Greater London Authority Acts 1999 and 2007; Town and Country Planning (Mayor of London) Order 2008Aberfeldy Estate, London Borough of Tower HamletsGLA reference: GLA/2023/0300/S3Tower Hamlets reference: PA/21/02377Notice of Representation Hearing: 26 January 2024On 10 November 2021, planning application (reference PA/21/02377) ("the Application") was submitted to the London Borough of Tower Hamlets Council ("the Council") by Aberfeldy New Village LLP  ("the Applicant") for the proposed redevelopment of land to the north of East India Dock Road (A13), East of Blackwall Tunnel Northern Approach Road (A12) and to the south-west of Abbott Road in the London Borough of Tower Hamlets. The Application was validated by the Council on 10 November 2021.Following receipt of notice from the Council on 19 April 2023 that it was minded to refuse planning permission for the redevelopment proposals at Aberfeldy Estate, the Deputy Mayor, acting under delegated authority, notified the Council on 2 May 2023, that the Mayor would act as the local planning authority for the purposes of determining the Application (under article 7 of the Town and Country Planning (Mayor of London) Order 2008 and the powers conferred on him by Section 2A of the 1990 Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended)).A public Representation Hearing is due to be held at City Hall, The Chamber (Kamal Chunchie Way, London E16 1ZE) on 26 January 2024, starting at 10.00am, for the Deputy Mayor for Planning, Regeneration and Skills, Jules Pipe, to consider the Application in detail and to determine whether or not planning permission should be granted.The hearing is open to the public and you are welcome to attend if you wish. We would be grateful if you could let us know in advance if you wish to attend, so we can prepare accordingly, by emailing aberfeldyestate@london.gov.uk. Details of how to get to City Hall can be found here: http://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/our-building-and-squares/how-find-city-hall
